name: evaluate unknown data
description:
Go back to astar and see how it works. the context doesn't match the goal specifically, but does it match it by type? I forget.
How do we determine that the goal can never be met? What parts of the goal are we missing?
How do we figure out the best way to reach the goal?
Do the sensors add data that says "explore here!"
Arbitrary exploring isn't always good. In a game about checking rooms, you just check more rooms until you find something.
Is our problem always going to be due to a lack of information? How does this play into a goal to matches by type, or does not match by type?
